FileFormat.FormatDescription: CINEMA 4D doesn’t use separate files for material, object and scene information. Instead CINEMA 4D uses one file format which can contain all these elements. That means one editor where animation, modeling, texturing and rendering can be done at the same time. CINEMA 4D uses IFF, which means Interchange File Format“. IFF is a chunk based format. IFF allows you to read only those structures of a file which your application can handle.
FileFormat.ProvenanceName: The National Archives and Records Administration / The National Archives and Records Administration
FileFormat.ProvenanceDescription: Specification Link: http://paulbourke.net/dataformats/cinema4d/cinema4d.pdf As quoted by Wikipedia Cinema 4D Version 1.0 was released in 1993.
